required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Probiotics on Oral Homeostasis During Sugar Stress
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Probiotics on Oral Homeostasis During Sugar Stress

brief_summary.textblock:
The present study is a double-blinded randomized clinical trial with a duration of 28 days.
80 orally and systemically healthy participant will be allocated in the test (probiotic) and the control (placebo) group at baseline.
The intervention is sugar stress, which will be applied at baseline and continue through day 14, followed by 14 days without sugar stress.
Clinical measurements and sampling will be performed at baseline, day 14 and day 28
Primary endpoint: Changes in microbial composition.
Secondary endpoints: Changes in clinical and immunological parameters

detailed_description.textblock:
The present study is a double-blinded randomized clinical trial with a duration of 28 days.
80 orally and systemically healthy participant will be allocated in the test (probiotic) and the control (placebo) group at baseline.
The intervention is sugar stress, which will be applied at baseline and continue through day 14, followed by 14 days without sugar stress.
Clinical measurements and sampling will be performed at baseline, day 14 and day 28
Primary endpoint: Changes in microbial composition.
Secondary endpoints: Changes in clinical and immunological parameters

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Double blinded randomized clinical trial with a test and placebo group
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Computerized randomization only known to the principal investigator, who are not directly involved in data collection or data analysis

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in microbial composition in dental plaque
primary_outcome.description: Changes in alpha and beta diversity of microbial composition

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in levels of dental plaque and gingival inflammation

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in salivary levels of inflammatory cytokines
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in mean salivary levels of selected inflammatory cytokines

arm_group.description: In this group participants will receive probiotic supplements twice a day (morning and evening) for at period of 28 days (14 days with sugar stress followed by 14 days without sugar stress).
In this group participants will receive placebo twice a day (morning and evening) for at period of 28 days (14 days with sugar stress followed by 14 days without sugar stress).

intervention.description: Sucrose rinsing for 14 days (8-10 times a day) followed by 14 days without sucrose rinsing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 18 yrs.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of oral diseases i.e. gingivitis, periodontitis and dental caries
- Current smokers
- Any systemic diseases and current use of any medication with known effect on oral health
- Use of systemic antibiotics within the latest three months.
- Age < 18 yrs., and age > 30 yrs.

facility.name: University of Copenhagen, Department of Odontology
